definition: person of low social status (old)/I, me (used to refer humbly to oneself)/nasty person/vile character
lit. a vile character flourishes (idiom)/fig. an inferior person gets into a position of power, becoming conceited and arrogant
to gauge the heart of a gentleman with one's own mean measure (idiom)
pinyin: yi3 xiao3 ren2 zhi1 xin1 , duo2 jun1 zi3 zhi1 fu4
containing_words.word: 以小人之心，度君子之腹

definition: see 大人不記小人過|大人不记小人过[da4 ren2 bu4 ji4 xiao3 ren2 guo4]
pinyin: jun1 zi3 bu4 ji4 xiao3 ren2 guo4

definition: good people are at peace with themselves, (but) there is no rest for the wicked
pinyin: jun1 zi5 tan3 dang4 dang4 , xiao3 ren2 chang2 qi1 qi1
containing_words.word: 君子坦蕩蕩，小人長戚戚

definition: a person of great moral stature does not remember the offenses committed by one of low moral stature
pinyin: da4 ren2 bu4 ji4 xiao3 ren2 guo4

sentences.english: Jam Ho is on Facebook. Join Facebook to connect with Jam Ho and others you may know.
sentences.chinese: 吳昭儀也是個平凡人，是跟你我一樣的小人物。

sentences.english: Guo eat while watching the picture storybook side starch noodles.
sentences.chinese: 郭同學一邊看小人書一邊喫炒粉。

sentences.english: He had a definite strain of snobbery in him.
sentences.chinese: 他這個人明顯有一股勢利小人的氣味。

sentences.english: In addition to study and practice, the amateur life is very small.
sentences.chinese: 除了學習和實踐，小人的業餘生活也非常豐富。

sentences.english: Not only the children but also their grandma wants to read the picture book.
sentences.chinese: 不僅孩子們想看小人書，他們的奶奶也想看。

sentences.english: The hero of LittleBigPlanet is a tiny person made out of some kind of coarse-textured fabric.
sentences.chinese: 遊戲的英雄是一個像是某種粗糙布料製作的小人。

sentences.english: I stood at a bookstand reading comic books.
sentences.chinese: 我站在一個書攤旁讀着小人書。

sentences.english: A geat man is always willing to be little.
sentences.chinese: 偉大的人物總是願意當小人物。

sentences.english: You're building a rat ship here. A vessel for sea going snitches.
sentences.chinese: 你正在這裏營造一艘小人船，一艘告密者的大船。

sentences.english: I bought the child a picture book.
sentences.chinese: 我給那孩子買了本小人書。

sentences.english: See, us thumb-slummers and box-jumpers, we get a little puckish when it comes to cars, you know?
sentences.chinese: 看，我們這些窮鬼和小人物，當看到車就會有點激動。

sentences.english: Rai Hu is on Facebook. Join Facebook to connect with Rai Hu and others you may know.
sentences.chinese: 李宥蓁也是個平凡人，是跟你我一樣的小人物。

sentences.english: Aya Ko is on Facebook. Join Facebook to connect with Aya Ko and others you may know.
sentences.chinese: 趙婉妤也是個平凡人，是跟你我一樣的小人物。

sentences.english: There was in him a headstrong little man who hated Napoleon.
sentences.chinese: 在他心裏早就有個憎恨拿破崙的頑固小人兒了。

sentences.english: Yap Ws is on Facebook. Join Facebook to connect with Yap Ws and others you may know.
sentences.chinese: 林姿杏也是個平凡人，是跟你我一樣的小人物。

sentences.english: He disdained that man for snobbishness and was unwilling to talk to him.
sentences.chinese: 他鄙視那個勢利小人，不願和他說話。

definition: two-faced, three knives (idiom); double-cross/double dealing and back stabbing
to incite a quarrel (idiom); to sow discord between people/to tell tales/to make mischief
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
to be greedy in getting money
to see profit and forget morality (idiom); to act from mercenary considerations/to sell one's soul for gain
to be glib in one's speech and wear an ingratiating expression (idiom)
